Call4Calm The Illinois Department of Human Services has launched a support line called Call4Calm that is reachable via text. Individuals who want to speak with a mental health professional can text the word "TALK" or "HABLAR" (for Spanish speakers) to 552-020. Within 24 hours, that individual will receive a call from a mental health professional employed by a local community health center.

People can also text other terms, like "unemployment" or "food" or "shelter" to the same number to receive information on how to navigate and access supports and services. Call4Calm is free, and individuals who use it can remain anonymous. We encourage you to share this resource with your students, families, and staff.

Student Council Food Drive
Thanksgiving is upon us. Please join the student council in helping others in need this holiday season. From Monday, November 18th to Friday, November 22nd student council will be hosting a food drive here at Newark High School. As a school, our goal is to collect 1,000 non-perishable items for charity. What if you don't have any extra non-perishable food to donate? You can donate money! Each 50 cent donation will count as one non-perishable items. Please make sure all money donations are turned into Mrs. McCoy or Mrs. Kotora.

If we hit our goal as a building, we will have a movie day on the morning of Monday, November 25th before Feed My Starving Children. This year, we will have battle of the classes. The class who contributes the most towards our goal will get to pick the movie! So, make sure you find your classes table in the student center from November 18th-November 22nd and let's all work together to make a difference!

Free Application for Western IL University
Attention Seniors: Western Illinois University is waiving the application fee for applying to Western from today through Sunday, October 27. Western is a Division 1 athletic school with much to offer. Some of their top programs include: law enforcement, broadcasting and journalism, speech pathology and audiology, accounting, nursing, meteorology, environmental geology, ag, supply chain management, recreation parks and tourism, and social work. They offer many scholarships with qualifications that start at a 3.3 gpa and a 980 SAT. In addition, those going into education who promise to teach in a rural area after graduation are awarded additional scholarship money. To learn more about Western, visit with the Western representative or meet with Mrs. McAnally.
